snippet: A law professor argues that monitoring fees, payments that companies make to their private equity owners in exchange for what regulatory filings call consulting and advisory services over time, resemble dividends.
abstract: A law professor argues that monitoring fees, payments that companies make to their private equity owners in exchange for what regulatory filings call consulting and advisory services over time, resemble dividends.

headline.main: Tax Expert Sees Abuse in a Stream of Private Equity Fees
